skill.author: Aykahshi

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill configuration file. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or command execution paths are present. The skill defines a 5-stage workflow orchestration that delegates actual execution to Claude's native capabilities and the copilot-mcp-server integration.

content.value_statement: Managing AI-assisted development becomes chaotic when switching between Claude and Copilot manually. Copilot Flow creates a structured 5-stage workflow that orchestrates both AI systems to analyze, design, implement, review, and deliver projects together.
actual_capabilities: Executes 5-stage workflow: Analyze, Design, Implement, Review, Deliver
Orchestrates Claude for requirements analysis, coding, and documentation
Integrates with Copilot MCP for architecture design and code review
Manages workflow state through intermediate files and history
Supports individual stage execution via slash commands
limitations: Requires copilot-mcp-server to be installed and configured
GitHub Copilot CLI must be available for design and review stages
Cannot operate without Claude or Claude Code as the orchestrator
Limited to workflows where both Claude and Copilot add value

use_cases.title: End-to-end feature development
use_cases.description: Complete feature implementation from requirements to delivery with AI-powered quality checks at each stage

use_cases.title: Architecture planning and review
use_cases.description: Leverage Copilot for architectural decisions while Claude handles implementation and documentation

use_cases.title: Infrastructure as code workflow
use_cases.description: Structured approach to designing, implementing, and reviewing infrastructure configurations with AI assistance

output: Stage 1: Analysis - Claude analyzes requirements and creates structured analysis
Stage 2: Design - Copilot MCP suggests architecture options
Stage 3: Implementation - Claude writes code based on design
Stage 4: Review - Copilot MCP reviews implementation quality
Stage 5: Delivery - Claude integrates and generates documentation
Output files: analysis-result.md, architecture-design.md, implementation-report.md, code-review-report.md

best_practices: Start with clear, specific requirements for the analysis stage
Review stage outputs before proceeding to maintain quality control
Use individual stage commands when you only need specific AI assistance
Check workflow-state.json when resuming interrupted workflows
anti_patterns: Skipping stages in full workflow mode without understanding consequences
Modifying intermediate files manually between stages
Running stages out of sequence without proper context
Ignoring Copilot review recommendations during delivery

faq.question: What is required before using this skill?
faq.answer: Install copilot-mcp-server and ensure GitHub Copilot CLI is configured. Claude handles orchestration.

faq.question: Can I skip stages in the workflow?
faq.answer: Full workflow executes all stages sequentially. Use individual slash commands for specific stages.

faq.question: How does state persistence work?
faq.answer: Workflow state is stored in .claude/workflow-state.json and stage outputs are saved as markdown files.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only orchestrates prompts. Actual code execution uses your existing Claude and Copilot security model.

faq.question: What if a stage fails?
faq.answer: Check workflow-state.json for current state. Resume from last completed stage or restart from specific stage.

faq.question: How is this different from using Claude alone?
faq.answer: Copilot Flow explicitly delegates design and review to Copilot while Claude handles analysis, implementation, and delivery.
